body: @nicoddemus ok if I roll with this one?

issue.title: Add deprecations for tests written for `nose`

repository.name: pytest
repository.description: The pytest framework makes it easy to write small tests, yet scales to support complex functional testing

issue.body:
Adds deprecation warnings for tests written in `nose`, namely around `setup` and `teardown` aspects; as we support limited functionality.

I went with a `pytest 8.x` deprecation as I think that is the norm here.  I also notice a few things when reviewing docs locally:

~my version was showing `6.3.x-dev*`~ was my fault;
`tox -e docs` does not work in python `3.10+` due to an upstream issue in `sphinx/util/typing.py` we may need a version bump there? I will chase that up in a second

closes #9886 

Todo:
 - Implement a solution for `call_optional(...)`
 - Investigate the mention of `@with_setup` etc.

issue.title: No CI for Python 3.10 yet

milestone.description: Finally letting the dead snakes lie. Also some nice new features.

repository.name: sopel
repository.description: :robot::speech_balloon: An easy-to-use and highly extensible IRC Bot framework. Formerly Willie.

issue.body:
Tin. We've still not enabled a CI job for Python 3.10 because of various errors encountered along the way while attempting to do so.

Ultimately, the cause is probably related to pytest-dev/pytest#9174, an issue that was closed but it seems not confirmed fixed. Uncertainty remains as to whether fixing this problem is up to the pytest team or the core Python developers. It looks like a regression (breaking something that worked in Python 3.9 and prior versions) but it appears to be taking longer to sort out than the `argparse` stuff we dealt with a while back.

While we believe Sopel should _run_ just fine on Python 3.10 in most cases, it's not currently possible to _test_ Sopel on that version.

<details>
<summary>Log from last attempt (CPython 3.10.4, pytest 6.2.5</summary>

issue.title: tests failures against Pytest 7.2.0
issue.body:
https://docs.pytest.org/en/latest/changelog.html#pytest-7-2-0-2022-10-23:
> [#9886](https://github.com/pytest-dev/pytest/issues/9886): The functionality for running tests written for nose has been officially deprecated.
> This includes:
> - Plain setup and teardown functions and methods: this might catch users by surprise, as setup() and teardown() are not pytest idioms, but part of the nose support.
> - Setup/teardown using the [@with_setup](https://docs.pytest.org/en/latest/with-setup-nose) decorator.
>
> For more details, consult the [deprecation docs](https://docs.pytest.org/en/latest/deprecations.html#nose-deprecation).

This leads to identical errors in `djangorestframework`'s tests
```
...
/usr/lib/python3/site-packages/_pytest/python.py:909: in xunit_setup_method_fixture
    warnings.warn(
E   pytest.PytestRemovedIn8Warning: Support for nose tests is deprecated and will be r
emoved in a future release.
E   tests/test_serializer_nested.py::TestNotRequiredNestedSerializerWithMany::test_mul
tipart_validate is using nose-specific method: `setup(self)`
E   To remove this warning, rename it to `setup_method(self)`
E   See docs: https://docs.pytest.org/en/stable/deprecations.html#support-for-tests-wr
itten-for-nose
...
==== 1178 passed, 124 skipped, 1 xpassed, 2 warnings, 122 errors in 39.40s =====
```

issue.title: `nose` tests being removed from pytest
issue.body: See https://github.com/pytest-dev/pytest/issues/9886. We still have some tests in this format that need refectoring, they are generating deprecation warnings currently.

issue.title: Renaming nose compatible methods in flavour of regular pytest naming

labels.name: changelog:skip
labels.description: Changes that should be skipped from the changelog (CI, tests, etc..)

labels.name: type:misc/internal
labels.description: Changelog: Misc changes that should appear in change log

labels.name: full tests needed
labels.description: We need to run full set of tests for this PR to merge

repository.name: airflow
repository.description: Apache Airflow - A platform to programmatically author, schedule, and monitor workflows

issue.body:
In pytest 7.2 execute nose compatible methods such as `setup()`/`teardown()` was removed: https://github.com/pytest-dev/pytest/issues/9886

Even though we use old version of pytest it better resolve it before we upgrade to the newest `pytest`

Most of the methods in this PR are actually fixtures and I don't think it affected by this deprecation.

issue.title: Replace setup() method with setup_method() to add compatibility with pytest 8

repository.name: remoto
repository.description: Remote commands (or processes calls) in Python.

issue.title: Update Testing Framework

type.name: Feature
type.description: A request, idea, or new functionality

issue.body: Testing software Nose is [deprecated](https://github.com/pytest-dev/pytest/issues/9886) and is [not maintained anymore](https://nose.readthedocs.io/en/latest/). PyNose has been used as a drop-in replacement for now. It should be replaced with either Nose2 or PyTest which appears to be the best solution. Research and evaluation for the best testing framework needs to be done.
